title: Initial Afghan Elections Went Well, But Worries Rise For Round Two
teaser: Afghanistan's presidential election in April left no candidate with more than 50 percent of the vote. A second-round election will be held on June 14 â€” during the peak of the Taliban fighting season. There are growing concerns that election day could be a blood bath, and that a close outcome would result in political instability.
